name: Galerie Polaris
profile:
History of Polaris Gallery
Untill 1984

After been located several years in Le Marais, at 8 rue Saint-Claude,in the center of Paris, the Polaris gallery opened in 2009 a second space, larger and more dedicated in showing bigger installations and videos, at just 50 meters from the first space. The development was confided to Odile Decq-Benoît Cornette, architects of recent Museum of Contemporary Art in Roma.

The gallery represents a small number of artists, preferring to focus on their work, as on their career. Main artists are regularly included in international exhibitions.

Beside contemporary photography - Eric Aupol (France), Yto Barrada (Morocco), Stéphane Couturier (France), Antonio Caballero (Mexico), Anthony Hernandez (USA)…, and drawing : Christian Lhopital (France), Casey Jex Smith (USA), Laure Tixier (France) Patrick Guns (Belgium) - the program also focuses on video - Simon Faithfull (England), Nigel Rolfe (Ireland), Assaf Shoshan (Israel), Yto Barrada (Morocco) - and painting - Simon Willems (England)  Philip Akkerman (Nethrlands) and installation Monika Brandmeier (Germany) and Walter Van Beirendonck (Belgium)

Polaris made the very first one man shows of the main artists represented, and is always open to emerging and newest tendencies in art.
